page.title: 03Farming
page.content: Crop farming is the main type of farming carried out in the area, as the rainfall is low and this part of N.E.Fife lies in a rain-shadow area created by the Lomond Hills. The soil is light and gravelly, due to glaciation in the past, and it dries quickly and drought is a problem. In spite of this farming is successful but the farmers have to work hard. A large farm has about six workers and the number of people needed has dropped, as it is cheaper to use machines. Barley, wheat, grass, potatoes, oil-seed rape, mangolds and some soft fruit are grown.The newest crop is oil-seed rape which is being grown more and more by E.E.C. countries. The oil is a substitute for soya bean oil imported from the U.S.A..
